This was a triumph!*
I'm making a note here:
"Huge success!!"

It's hard to overstate
My satisfaction.

Aperture science:
We do what me must
Because we can.

For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying
Over every mistake.
You just keep on trying
Till you run out of cake.
And the science gets done.
And you make a neat gun
For the people who are
Still alive.

I'm not even angry...
I'm being so sincere right now-
Even though you broke my heart,
And killed me.

And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because
I was so happy for you!

Now, these points of data
Make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta.
We're releasing on time!
So I'm glad i got burned-
Think of all the things we learned-
For the people who are
Still alive.

Go ahead and leave me...
I think I'd prefer to stay inside...
Maybe you'll find someone else
To help you?
Maybe black mesa?
That was a joke! ha ha!! fat chance!!

Anyway this cake is great!
It's so delicious and moist!

Look at me: still talking
When there's science to do!
When I look out there,
'It makes me glad I'm not you!'

I've experiments to run.
There is research to be done.
On the people who are
Still alive.
And believe me I am
Still alive.
I'm doing science and I'm
Still alive.
I feel fantastic and I'm
Still alive.
While you're dying I'll be
Still alive.
And when you're dead I will be
Still alive.

Still alive.

Still alive.

Vete y sigue bajando.
Tal vez encuentres a alguien que escriba un buen análisis.

Quizá en Black Mesa...

Тортик – это ложь.
Ложь – это боль (наверное).
Боль – это получить в затылок еб*чий шар из-за невнимательности.

9 еб*чих шаров из 10.




*обновлён ради значка*

İndirimdeyken almıştım verdimiğim parayı sonuna köküne kadar hak eden bir oyun kendine has mizahı eğlenceli bulmaca sistemi ve portal açma mekaniyle çok keyifli bir oynanış sunuyor.Senaryosuyla ön plana cıkan bir oyun değil zaten oyunda kendimizden başka 1 tane karakter var oyun boyunca bir tane bile karşılıklı dialog olmuyor buna ragmen portal sürükleyici bir oyun gladusun her konuşması her eylemi ayrı bir eğlence bazen sizi güldürüyor bazen düşünduyor bazen siz farkına bile varmadan amaçları uğruna size kulanabiliyor süprizle dolu.Portal her oyuncunun bir kez oynaması gereken oyunlardan bence kesinlikle zaman kaybı değil bulmaca oyunu olması sıkıcı veya size hitap etmediği anlamına gelmez çok zor bir oyun da değil tek yaptıgınız şeyin üstünüze kürekle atlılan düşmanları oldürmek olduğu fps oyunlarından bin kat daha iyi

Awesome. Bought it expecting it to be a bit dated compared to the second game, but boy was I wrong. The game is amazing, with sprinkles of lore all over. I'm glad I beat it in one sitting because now I can go back and replay it again and again. Not to mention the song at the end was well done by valve. All around no complaints as far as the gameplay/lore/voicing go, and I recommend this for anyone who's played Portal 2 or just in general!

Bewertung: 

P= Maximal Punktzahl

Grafik: 2P
Vertonung: 2P
Gameplay: 5P
Rätsel: 5P
Charaktere: 3P
Story: 3P

Bei den Punkten Grafik und Vertonung werde ich grösstenteils rein subjektiv bewerten da ich eigentlich keine Ahnung habe und deshalb nur die Wirkung auf denn Spieler selbst bewerten kann.

Grafik 1.5/2P
Die Grafik von Portal kann sich auch nach 10 Jahren noch sehen lassen und ist schön gealtert. Trotzdem wer ein Grafikfeuerwerk erwartet liegt falsch. Auch ein Minuspunkt ist FÜR MICH das ACHTUNG SPOILER die Kulissen hinter den Testräumen eigentlich alle gleich aussehen. SPOILER ENDE

Vertonung 2/2P
Bei der Vertonung bezieh ich mich hauptsächlich auf die Stimme von GLaDOS die echt super gemacht ist. Da man GLaDOS bis am Schluss eigentlich nur hört ist das auch sehr wichtig. Die Stimme von GLaDOS ist angenehm zu hören und nervt trotz der Verzerrung nicht.

Gameplay 5/5P
Da Portal hauptsächlich von seiner Geschichte und seiner Rätsel lebt ist natürlich auch das Gameplay wichtig. Die Portalgun ist eine wirklich gelungene Gameplay Mechanik die hier mit Dingen wie der Schwerkraft und zusätzlichen Items wie den Würfeln sehr schön und vielfältig benutzt wird.

Rätsel 4.5/5P
Die meisten Rätsel in Portal sind echt fordernd (egal ob mit zwei oder mit einem Portal). Trotzdem sind vorallem die Herausforderungsräume eher langweilig oder sehr unfair als das sie lustig sind. Trotzdem sehr coole Rätsel.


Charaktere 3/3P
Auch hier kann ich mich mal wieder nur auf GLaDOS konzentrieren da die eigene Spielfigur stumm ist und der Companion Cube nun mal einfach nicht sprechen kann. GLaDOS ist warscheinlich eine der beliebtesten Antagonisten in Videospielen was nicht zuletzt an ihrer Art dich manchmal permanent zu verarschen oder dich in lebensgefährliche Situationen zu bringen und dabei so zu tun als wär das doch alles vollkommen egal liegt. 

Story 2/3
Die Story von Portal ist auch wieder sehr gut erzält und kommt dabei sogar mit nur einer Erzählstimme aus. Wobei man als Spieler schon gerne wüsste wieso man hier ist und wer man ist. Trotzdem super Geschichte mit super Antagonistin.

Fazit 18/20P
Mit Portal hat Valve einen Zeitlosen Klassiker erschaffen den man auch nach Zehn Jahren noch mal herauskramen und spielen kann. Die 19.- sind es dabei allemal Wert.

I may be the dumbest genius ever. At least, that's how I feel after playing Portal 2's fantastic single-player campaign. Many puzzles in the last third of the eight to 10 hours (perhaps less, depending on how clever you are) of its brain-bending puzzle “test chambers” had me convinced at one point or another that they were completely unsolvable, and that some bug or sadist game designer placed the exit just out of reach. I'd let out exasperated sighs as every attempt met with a dead end. I'd grimace in disapproval as I plummeted to my death for the tenth time. I'd consider surrender.

Then, through either sudden revelation, divine inspiration, or total accident, it would come to me: use the orange Propulsion Gel to reach the energy bridge, then catapult across the chasm and shift my blue portal to the inclined surface (in mid-air, mind you) to launch me up to the ledge, grab the refraction cube and redirect the laser beam to wipe out the turrets and activate the switch! It's so simple, I can't believe I didn't see it until now. One half of Portal 2's brilliance is making me kick myself for not thinking of the impossible; the other is making me feel immensely satisfied with myself when I finally do, again and again.

Note: while we've made every effort to avoid spoilers in this review, you cannot review a game without discussing what it does well and what it doesn't. Be aware that reading any review is going to take some of the surprise out of it.

Test Subject: Dan-01

That achievement is made possible by the wondrous Portal Gun, the game's sole piece of equipment. Unchanged from the first game (except for some subtle but slick texture work and portals that can be seen through walls, Left 4 Dead-style) the easy-to-use gun reliably casts one orange portal and one blue portal against certain walls, allowing you to magically, instantaneously pass from one to the other, regardless of distance, obstacles, or line of sight, while preserving momentum. It's the ultimate non-weapon weapon, a sort of physics-based Judo-bazooka that redirects the strengths of energy and objects in motion toward its user's goals—including the user herself. Wielding it makes me feel more powerful—and smarter—than nearly any other gun in gaming.



The third half of Portal 2's brilliance is its story. (Yes, third half. If Valve can disregard the laws of physics in its game, I can disregard the laws of math in my review.) Its chambers are cohabitated by hilariously well-written and acted characters that exude personality, despite none of them being technically people. All three major roles rattle off absurd dark humor and petty insults at every turn. Evil robot GLaDOS is in top politely murderous form right from the moment she appears on screen (spoiler alert: she's still alive!), but Portal's show-stealing monotone antagonist is challenged for the spotlight by Wheatley, the bumbling, chattering robot who helps you escape.

Fantastically voiced by British actor Stephen Merchant (basically playing the same mind-bogglingly stupid character from the Ricky Gervais comedy Extras), Wheatley's a doofus AI who makes you turn around while he hacks doors (he can't do it while you're watching). Also in the mix is actor JK Simmons, who lends his fittingly cantankerous voice to the founder of Aperture, Cave Johnson, whose comically sociopathic approach to science is second only to GLaDOS'.

Sure, I saw the plot twists coming, but still looked forward to witnessing exactly how the characters would react. Through death, resurrection, revenge, and reversal of fortune, their charm makes what would otherwise be an empty and lifeless world feel boisterous and alive—and more than makes up for the player character being a faceless mute.

It does all this and more while recycling very few of Portal's greatest comedy hits—there's nary a nod to dishonest cake, and the beloved Weighted Companion Cube makes only a cameo appearance. And the finale? Not challenging in the least, but a spectacular and extremely clever finish to the story, with extra points for those who've paid close attention to Mr. Johnson.

New dimensions

Without changing the nature of the established and celebrated gameplay, Portal 2's gentle learning curve begins by reintroducing us to its basic concepts, then keeps on introducing new inventions to use with portals until around three quarters of the way through, and chambers become complex jungles of hazardous obstacles. Lasers emitting from walls combine with moveable Refractor Cubes to create the closest thing Portal 2 has to an offensive weapon—an aimable laser—but more often your job is to focus the beam on trigger switches through portals. Infinitely useful Excursion Funnels (levitation beams) and Light Bridges are more than just here-to-there movers—they can be applied to block or push away turrets, halt a catapulting jump before it throws you into oblivion, or help you climb a sheer wall.

I'm a little less wowed by the three flavors of viscous gel, which flow with a hypnotic globular effect from spouts and coat the environment in bouncy, speedy, or portal-receptive ooze. Unlike most of Portal 2's other devices, these have only a couple of uses at most, and can be difficult to control. It's a hassle when you're trying to paint an orange runway up to a blue bouncing patch that launches you through a portal cast on a white patch, only to have an errant blob of blue splash over everything. That's not to say that it's not great when your work of physics-defying impressionistic art comes together, of course.

不错的游戏，夏促6块钱1和2一起买的，超赚的。主要是解谜吧，

不过也有些东西要吐槽一下，成就系统貌似有点问题，有的成就进度显示满了但是并没有立即解锁，或者游戏里面显示是解锁了大但是steam上没有显示（都是联网打出来的，应该不会出这样的问题啊），然后就是“拒绝拍照”这个成就本来以为是一个很好打的成就，结果发现是要拆掉所有能拆的，而且必须一次完成，，不然还得从头打心累。。。还有就是奖励地图有两个地方操作难度太高（不是谜题难 而是太欺负手残党，因为操作太难我差点以为解法有误，去翻了攻略 确实就是那么过的，就是手速和按键的准确性。。），嗯差不多也就这些地方可以吐槽吧。
vyborna hra sice je kratší a lechčí než jeho druhej díl ale určitě se vyplatí zahrát

Le jeu est sympa, a peu près ce que j'espérais après avoir joué à Portal 2, mais outre la deception vu le nombre de fois où on m'a survendu ce jeu comme l'ultime saint graal du gaming, je le trouve cher pour le contenu. J'ai quand même fini la campagne en moins de deux heures, j'ai vu des jeux se faire tanner pour moins que ça.

C'est tout de même un jeu sympatoche a prendre en promo (1€)

Par contre, j'ai jamais compris pourquoi tout le monde crache sur Portal 2 au profit du 1, je veux dire, y'a de nouvelles mécaniques, plus de test donc une durée de vie plus longue et Glados est juste génial au lieu d'être juste une sociopathe tueuse en série. A la rigueur, y'a quelques trucs (comme les bouboules d'énergie) qui ont disparu et qui aurait pu rallonger la durée de vie de Portal 2 un peu plus, mais c'est pas un drame non plus.
游戏有些难度，可能前十七关一个小时就过了，但相信我，后面的关卡，有些地方你会看不到——然后你就像个没头苍蝇一样找啊找，就掉到下水道里面去了
可以在打折的时候入手，游戏玩法相对新颖，富有创造力，需要耐心思考，靠智商。总体来说，通关时间较短，不过可玩性十分不错

О-о-о, я бы хотел начать с дизайна уровней. А они шикарны - это первая причина почему стоит купить эту игру. Сюжет такой же загадочный, как и g-man, что заставляет думать, не хуже, чем над головоломками. Порталы! Кто бы мог подумать, что можно замутить такое в играх. Сама игра иногда даже пугает, а на финал я потратил почти все время и думал, что умру, но чудом успел, но там оставались сотые секунды, поэтому к концу игры вы будете ловить такой драйв и адреналин. А так было весело. Так что смело 10/10. За все. Всем спасибо за внимание!

Bienvenido a Aperture Cience, "sujeto de prueba". Fuiste elegido de entre miles, junto con otros miles de voluntarios forzados para llevar a cabo experimentos letales en nombre de la ciencia! Pero no te dejes llevar por la palabra letal, es solo una palabra para añadir emocion a tu estadia en los campos de prueba de Aperture. Ademas, seras participe de uno de los mas grandes avances cientificos de la historia, y, a pesar que nadie sepa que exististe y la historia te borre para siempre desvinculandote totalmente de dichos logros, alegrate, pues tu podras sentirte orgulloso de tu aporte. Para mas alegria, Aperture te dara la despedida de tus pruebas con un delicioso pastel! Si! Un pastel! No puedes creerlo, verdad? Pues si, asi de emocionados tambien nos sentimos en Aperture por nuestros logros y tu participacion!...

Bien. Por si el preambulo no ha explicado lo suficiente, aqui va mi opnion del juego en general:
Portal te adentra en un enorme laboratorio, donde tu rol no es mas que el de un conejillo de indias.
Equipado con un dispositivo de portales (una extraña arma cuyos disparos habren portales que te permiten ir de un punto a otro en el plano) deberas usar tu ingenio para resolver varias camaras de pruebas donde realmente puedes morir. Daras saltos agigantados y caeras ileso (gracias a unas botas especiales que amortiguan cualquier caida). Redirigiras proyectiles, completaras puzzles y da por hecho que en algunos casos, el paso entre portales repetido te producira mareos. Todo acompañado y  guiado por la voz de GLaDOS, una inteligencia artificial que observa tus acciones tomando nota, evaluando y a veces haciando comentarios sarcasticos y graciosos.

-HISTORIA: Olvidaras muy rapido la trama, ya que no es muy profunda y poco explica. Solo sabes que eres un sujeto de pruebas sacrificable que esta cautivo por una empresa que mira al futuro. El resto queda mas que nada a deducir por pequeños grafitis en zonas escondidas, comentarios de GLaDOS que dejan que pensar y [spoiler] tus intentos de escapar de dichas pruebas (con mas seriedad) tras que intentan deshacerte de ti. [/spoiler]
Resumiendo, es una historia que es pobre pero se justifica debido a que el juego es un puzzle y que dura apenas 2 horas.

-JUGABILIDAD: Tan sencilla como perfecta. No necesitas mas que los mandos basicos de cualquier FPS. Todo se basa en tu habilidad en puzzles y el uso de portales y gravedad. Cualquiera puede jugarlo, hasta los mas novatos en juegos de pc. Pero esto no quita nada bueno de la jugabilidad o juego en si. Aunque depende para quien y su experiencia en puzzles, estos pueden representar muy poca dificultad. En lo personal, toda la campaña, en especial el final, es muy facil.

-GRAFICOS Y FISICA: Si bien no posee un avanzado motor grafico, estos son mas que suficiente y bonitos como para que te olvides de ello y puedas disfrutar y adentrarte en el juego. Sus texturas, aunque algo pobres, bastan ya que casi todo el juego te envolvera de lisas paredes. Sus efectos especiales no son gran cosa pero es muy poco el aprecio que puedes darle debido a su escasa presencia. Su fisica, no puedo criticarla, es muy corto el tiempo que jugaras su campaña como para encontrar fallos. Yo no halle ninguno asi que en ese sentido le doy mi bien visto.

-MULTIJUGADOR: No posee, pero si puedes hallar pruebas diseñadas por otras personas que te desafiaran quizas mucho mas que la misma campaña, y esto hace del juego infinito en niveles, ya que no hay pocos niveles creados, sino cientos, mas bien miles. Si quieres tambien puedes diseñar tu tu propio nivel para desafiar a otros jugadores con tu creacion.

En resumen general, es un gran juego de puzzle muy entretenido, sencillo y bonito. Aunque su trama es pobre porque, a pesar de que podria ser muy buena, no te da tiempo a adentrarte. Es un juego perfecto para los novatos del puzzle ya que no es un gran desafio a la mente, pero eso no lo hace un mal juego. Su precio quizas no sea el adecuado debido a su duracion y desempeño en dificultad, pero no me arrepiento ni tu lo haras de comprarlo...

Puntuacion personal  6.5/10

Ótimo jogo, nunca chegará aos pés de Portal 2, mas se você quer Portal 2, esse jogo é uma introdução maravilhosa para esse mundo, tornando sua próxima experiência  ainda mais maravilhosa. Quem jogar este e não jogar sua continuação merece um bolo, mas AQUELE bolo, se você entender o motivo do bolo ser uma mentira, vá jogar. Portal é curto, mas o jogo possui uma ideia esplêndida, um precedente da obra-prima que é Portal 2.
Outra coisa que merece destaque além da ideia do jogo, é a vilã, a GLaDOS, que mesmo sendo a antagonista, conquista todos os corações, seu comportamente psicológico muito bem desenvolvido é a cereja do bolo, e que cereja.
Jogo leve e super legal, melhor puzzle que eu joguei e o unico com uma historia Curta porem divertida

A great game that takes only a couple hours to finish, yet the advanced challenges take way more time. It has a nice backstory that is engaging, the graphics are good, and the test chambers are designed very well. Not as hard as it's successor, but is great nonetheless. It's better if it is played before Portal 2.

I went into this game after hearing unanimously positive things about it. Based on its novel gameplay, cool mechanics, and how badly it made me want that cake, I now count myself among those who say positive things about it.
Incredible.  5 playthroughs, and it's still a joy.
